https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Kp: A Glavenus subspecies that flings highly corrosive acid around with each swing of its tail.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Er: Known as a symbol of destruction, it's rumored to harness the full force of nature, but no records remain.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/N3: A creature so old and powerful that it is sometimes worshipped as a native deity in the world it hails from.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Zq: A belligerent monster that will fight anything. Watch out for its dangerous kicks and bites.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Ba: A Rathalos clad in azure-tinted scales. Favors aerial assaults on its prey.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/6d: This monster gouges out the earth with its two massive horns as it charges at foes.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/4k: A snow-white flying wyvern found in the frozen tundra. It uses its wings and tail to traverse ice with ease.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Z9: A monster that marks its territory with mud as it searches for its favorite snack, ants.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Xe: A nefarious monster that patrols the entire continent in search of prey. Able to scatter explosive scales.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/yA: A beast from another world.  Sports a muscular frame and two gigantic horns.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Oq: The wedge-shaped head of this piscine monster allows it to freely swim through the tundra snow.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Ro: During mating season, Diablos scales turn a deep black. They are known as the mothers of the Wildspire Waste.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/WQ: A Vaal Hazak variant encrusted with spores that spew a toxic effluvium at any who draw close.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/qp: This brute wyvern uses its saliva to prime the sticky slime coating its arms, rendering it highly explosive.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/j1: Blackish brown scales and a stronger roar set this Tigrex subspecies  apart. It is extremely aggressive.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/aY: A subspecies of Pukei-Pukei capable of expelling water stored in its body from its mouth and tail.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/4r: A dreadful, and hungry brute wyvern. Capable of flailing monsters around after clamping down on them.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/BY: The ruler of the Wildspire Waste. Extremely territorial with a penchant for sudden charges.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Dm: An obese monster that gorges on minerals. Its saliva acts as an explosive catalyst.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/v2: This ravenous Odogaron subspecies carries its kills in its mouth and grows frenzied upon feeding.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/jA: The legendary black dragon that obliterated a country in a single night. It now presides in the ruins of its castle.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Ba: A variant Barioth uses a sub-zero breath attack to slow down prey before it goes in for the kill.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/zJ: With every attack, this Anjanath subspecies fortifies its jaws and dorsal membrane with electricity.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/jN: A Rajang variant with a golden mane. Even more aggressive than a normal Rajang; sparks with a fury when enraged.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Lk: A brute wyvern that wields its heavy tail like a blade. With each strike, it gathers heat until it glows red.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Ba: Few sightings of this rare gleaming gold-scaled Rathian species have ever been reported.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/eM: Travels with other, smaller Girros. Utilizes its paralyzing fangs to capture prey.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/zJ: The voracious alpha leader of the Jagras. Constantly on the hunt for its next meal.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/oA: A massive piscine wyvern that uses the surrounding mud not only as armor, but as a weapon.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/BQ: A phantasmal creature that few have ever seen. Catching a glimpse of this creature is a shocking sight.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/YQ: A bird wyvern that utilizes its developed forelimbs to attack with all sorts of tools.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/5x: An elder dragon clad in a gold mantle. Breaking its horns require several different measures.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/jJ: An elder dragon cloaked in fierce winds, preventing anyone from approaching.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/BL: A vicious piscine wyvern that swims in lava, and uses hardened magma as armor.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/QN: The lord of the Coral Highlands. It emits a chilling wind from its body, to slow down its prey.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Gm: A creature from another world living deep in primeval forests. Can control flora and fauna within its territory.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/j8: A female elder dragon, with crown-like horns and blue hide. Emits intense heat.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Mz: An elder dragon shrouded in water. Able to generate electricity within its body to hurl at its foes.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/BK: Extremely agile on the ground, this obsidian-furred flying wyvern moves with explosive bursts of speed.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/aY: A terrible elder dragon with a well- documented appetite for destruction. It has no concern for its own well-being.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/QN: The gusts of air expelled by this Paolumu subspecies are laced with a powerful sedative, causing sleep.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/AD: A terrifying monster that scours the land in search of carrion to bring back to its nest.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/2m: Enjoys snacking on the eggs of the Coral Highlands. It releases the air in its body to move at high speeds.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Bn: A Rathian clad in shimmering blossom scales. Favors attacking with its poisonous tail.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/ne: A vile monster that carries poison in its internal organs, which it mixes  with flora to spit at targets.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/v2: A brute wyvern dressed in an armor of bones. It curls up into a ball for movement and to attack.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Jo: A Brachydios variant much larger than the normal species. The slime on its body will activate and explode over time.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/jJ: Extremely territorial and aggressive. When enraged, it can destroy shock traps. Attack its tail to stop its rampage.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Bn: The Ancient Forest's apex predator patrols the skies, always on the lookout for intruders.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Rz: The queen of the land, armed with powerful kicks and a lethal poison.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/oA: Countless battles have only hardened this Nergigante variant. Its spikes grow tougher as it loses health.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/0k: The fully grown form of Xeno'jiiva. It absorbs energy from its environment to heal itself and alter the ecosystem.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/B0: A mutated Deviljho variant, driven mad by its overpowering hunger. It will attempt to feed on all it sees.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/46: Like the regular species, its parts break easily and it tires quickly, but its behavior differs somewhat.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/6d: The scales of this Bazelgeuse variant burn hotter than normal, yielding a wider explosion radius.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/8m: A mysterious elder dragon able to manipulate veins of ore. Vibrations from its wingtips reshape the earth.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Dm: White frost coats the body of this Legiana variant. It attacks with icy winds and overhead dives.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/B0: Few sightings of this rare shimmering silver-scaled Rathalos species have ever been reported.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/vm: Has a symbiotic relationship with Dracophage Bugs, which it releases like bullets. Highly dangerous.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/jG: An elder dragon wreathed in flame. A gnash of its sharp fangs can detonate its scattered scales.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/jV: A flying wyvern straight out of prehistory, known for its deafening roar and overwhelming charge.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/bl: Resides in the upper reaches of the Ancient Forest. Is capable of storing static electricity within its fur.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/WQ: Blinds both prey and enemies with a special pulsing organ on its head.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/z9: A monster that uses its enormous jaw to crush ore for consumption.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/9m: A dreadful elder dragon that lives within the effluvium. If the vapor dissipates, it'll accumulate more.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/J1: An elder dragon said to freeze all in its path. Its breath conjures ice spires from the mist it emits.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/2m: The tail of this subspecies secretes a toxin while its fangs paralyze prey. It can glide without climbing trees.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/jX: A bird wyvern marked by its hard, black scales and impressive mane.  It strikes with its distinctive beak.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Ak: Lightning courses through this fanged wyvern's fur. It is most deadly in its supercharged state.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Em: An elder dragon with a shell so massive and towering, it's mistaken for a volcano.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Bn: An herbivore that has developed a thick carapace to protect it from would-be attackers.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Rz: Herbivores that are often the target of many predators. They often flee as a herd.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/QZ: Wingdrakes that somehow survive in harsh conditions. Equipped with a deadly acid that they can spit.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Bg: Giant piscine that patrol their waters with the ferocity of a large monster.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/vm: Pack monsters that are easily angered by intruders, and will charge at monsters twice their size.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/eQ: Pack monsters that attack with paralyzing fangs.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Bw: Insects that inhabit various lands. Their thick shells protect them from attacks.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/wa: Territorial monsters that will, as a pack, ambush other monsters when given the chance.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Ro: Docile herbivores. Their horns are valued for their medicinal properties.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Ba: Docile herbivores. Their horns are valued for their medicinal properties.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/eQ: Females will alert the herd while hard-hitting males attack without prejudice.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Y7: Females will alert the herd while hard-hitting males attack without prejudice.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/Er: Wingdrakes that travel in gigantic flocks. Crafty hunters can use them as transportation.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/B0: A small monster that uses its keen sense of smell to track its favorite food, mushrooms.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/9x: Wingdrakes that will produce a sound similar to explosions when startled by screamer pods.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/bx: Wingdrakes that inhabit the Coral Highlands. They feast on eggs in large flocks.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/2r: Small nocturnal monsters that patrol their territory aggressively.
https://mhworld.kiranico.com/monsters/RE: Their stingers contain a paralyzing agent. Their parts are useful for slinger ammo and poison weapons.
